content.description:
Sit start on an incut edge to the right on the inside of the crack. Move up the crack using fist jams (if your hands are big enough). There are good foot jams in the crack and foot holds just outside of the crack. The top is wide. 

  It's easier to do this as a layback rather than purely jamming in it.
content.location: Park behind Wendy's or at one of the bike trail parking lots.  Cross Rte 85 (from the Wendy's side) where the bike trail cuts back away from the road right after going under the two bridges (I-495). Take the trail with a gate up to the cell tower and look to your right under the power lines. This is basically the first big rock you see. This is on the same boulder as Powerline Backbreaker.

content.description: Sit start in a small cave and climb straight to the top.
content.location: This is on the powerlines south side of 85. It is a bit hard to see. Head in towards the cell tower, and keep an eye on the powerline cut. You should see it.

content.description: Start matched on a crimper. Make a couple obvious moves to the top.
content.location: This is on the same boulder as Buzz Lightyear.

content.description: I found this while out on a night hike and have been back to it a couple times. It is a relatively large boulder with holds all over it on two sides. There is potential for something harder on the almost blank side.
content.location:
This thing is kind of a pain in the ass to get to (easier to find when there are no leaves on the trees). 

  Go to the Buzz Lightyear Boulder. Right next to it, there is a big rusty powerlines pole. If you look at the top, you should see that it's pole number 130. The Jungle Book Boulder is near pole number 135. To get there, walk past the "mushroom drop" and follow the trail as it turns into the woods (this is a wide trail that jeeps used to drive on) and keep going down. You will parallel the highway for a hundred yards or so, and then the trail turns back towards the powerlines. Follow the trail out to the powerlines (passing the old, smashed up car). Follow the obvious powerlines trail until you see it or you get to pole 135. It's on your right. Plow through some annoying underbrush to get to it.  

  ...good luck.

content.description: Sit start starting on a dish.  Bump up to two small holds.  Traverse left using small crimpers (crux).  Shoot your left hand to a sloper on the arete and finish straight up.
content.location: This is on the powerlines' south side of Rt. 85 on top of the hill.  The boulder is the on the highest part of the hill.

content.description: Start low and bump up the fin/ramp thing using heel hooks. Top out at the highest point.
content.location: This is in the Vietnam area. From Rte. 85, head up the powerlines until you get to the top. You should see it on your right hand side at this point. There is a trail that goes right to it.     If you or someone you know mountain bikes up here, this is the boulder at the beginning of the run in for "The Mushroom Drop."

content.description: This area has always been referred to as "Vietnam" by the mountain bikers.  NEMBA owns a parcel of land here.  This area includes the vicinity of the Powerlines that run adjacent to the highway on either side of Route 85.
